q: The Republican-led House has launched an outrageous assault on women's rights and wants to take away the rights of our sisters, daughters and granddaughters to make their own health care decisions," Barbara Boxer Frank Lautenberg said. Once again, we are seeing a male-o-garchy trying to turn the clock back on women's health. I remain committed to ensuring that American women always have the right to choose what's best for their own lives and their own bodies. "Republicans claim that they want to keep government out of people's lives, but they insist on asserting their authority in the lives of women," Barbara Boxer Kirsten Gillibrand said. Cairo had raised fears that the country could suffer the same loss of cultural heritage as occurred in Iraq in 2003 after the fall of Saddam Hussein . Egypt's cultural treasures are now secure, Zahi Hawass said. The Valley of the Kings is safe, the pyramids are safe, 24 museums are safe, the synagogues and the monasteries and the Muslim monuments are completely safe, he said. he sees no reason why the military shouldn't be considered for spending cuts as lawmakers grapple with the ballooning deficit. Mr. Colin Powell pointed out that defense spending had at one time been cut 25%. I don't think the defense budget should be made sacrosanct, he said. The Obama administration has proposed cutting$ 78 billion from the military budget in the next five years.
